thread.title: Flatlands Dance Theatre members now dancing to rock 'n' roll
thread.title_full: Flatlands Dance Theatre members now dancing to rock 'n' roll

author: Staff
title: Flatlands Dance Theatre members now dancing to rock 'n' roll
text:
Flatlands Dance Theatre members now dancing to rock 'n' roll Entertainment brief Posted: October 16, 2015 - 12:00am 
The Flatlands Dance Theatre will perform a program called “Texas Music Icons: A Rockin’ Evening of Dance” at 8 p.m. Oct. 23-24 in the Firehouse Theatre at LHUCA, 511 Ave. K. 
Most choreographers are working with songs by such Texas artists as Buddy Holly, Janis Joplin and Stevie Ray Vaughan. 
Some music for dances will be performed live by local artists Gypsy Jane and Phlip Coggins with the Lotharios. 
Guest artist and scholar Roger Landes will narrate excerpts of the history of rock ’n’ roll music in Texas. 
Choreographers are Ashley Anderson, Ali Duffy, Leslie Gomez, Valerie Hill, Elizabeth Johnson, Sarah Mondle, Kyla Olson, Molly Roberts, Sarah Sabin and Rachel Ure. 
Dancers are Ashley Anderson, Bianca Barrera, Chelsea Bohny, Katie Cowley, Celeste Delgado, Aimee Dixon, Ali Duffy, Nathalie van Gilder, Leslie Gomez, Elizabeth Johnson, Allison Jones, Hannah Miller, Sarah Mondle, Kris Olson, Kyla Olson, Allison Pelham, Sarah Sabin and Rebecca Seitz. Dancing to rock  Attraction: Flatland Dance Theatre performing “Texas Music Icon, Rockin’ Evening of Dance.”  When: 8 p.m. Oct. 23-24.  Where: Firehouse Theatre at LHUCA, 511 Ave. K.  Tickets: Select-A-Seat outlets. General admission seating is $25 for the general public and $15 for seniors age 60 and older, students and children age 17 and younger (includes service charge).  Information: 770-2000.
